definition: to catch sight of in a doorway (old)
board/plank/plate/shutter/table tennis bat/clappers (music)/CL:塊|块[kuai4]/accented beat in Chinese music/hard/stiff/to stop smiling or look serious

sentences.english: When inflexible rules are imposed on flexible humans, both sides lose.
sentences.chinese: 当死板的规则强加在灵活的人类身上时，两面皆输。

sentences.english: If we become too rigid, we will break in the face of the pressures of life.
sentences.chinese: 如果我们变得太死板，会破坏我们生活中面对的压力。

sentences.english: You’ve long been a proponent of hard data and statistics.
sentences.chinese: 你已经长时间的作为死板的数据和统计的倡议者。

sentences.english: These things give a person a kind of icy and formalist sense.
sentences.chinese: 这些东西给人一种冰凉死板的感觉。

sentences.english: The Founder that the curve of gentle and lovely broke a room and formalist .
sentences.chinese: 柔媚的曲线打破了房间的方正和死板。

sentences.english: In this regard, the phased approach to the declaration of a pandemic was rigid and confining.
sentences.chinese: 在这方面，宣布大流行的分阶段方法有些死板和局限。

sentences.english: The statement accompanying the decision was, at first glance, hard nosed.
sentences.chinese: 乍看起来，这样的声明和决定是非常死板顽固的。

sentences.english: He also struggled to leave his rigid scientific training behind.
sentences.chinese: 他也抗争着把死板的科学课程丢在一边。

sentences.english: And I've discovered that most young men do not stand like ramrods or talk like Demosthenes.
sentences.chinese: 我发现多数的年轻男孩不能接受死板严厉的说教。

sentences.english: Nixon suffered from a cold and bad makeup.
sentences.chinese: 而尼克松由于死板而糟糕的化妆而吃了亏。

sentences.english: Traditional Japanese inns, or ryokan, abound in this area.
sentences.chinese: 死板的日本旅店山庄，座落于该区。

sentences.english: The Army should start by breaking down its rigid promotion ladder.
sentences.chinese: 陆军应该从打破死板的晋升阶梯着手。

definition: lit. one strong beat and one weak beats in a measure of music (two beats in the bar) (idiom); fig. follow a prescribed pattern to the letter/scrupulous attention to detail
nothing much changes (idiom); always the same/stuck in a rut
to follow the compass and go with the set square (idiom); to follow the rules inflexibly/to act according to convention
pragmatic/flexible/to act differently in different situations/to accommodate to circumstances
